an1.209:1.1: “The foremost of my monk disciples who want to train is Rāhula.
an1.210:1.1: … who went forth out of faith is Raṭṭhapāla.
an1.211:1.1: … who are the first to pick up a ballot slip is Kuṇḍadhāna.
an1.212:1.1: … who are eloquent poets is Vaṅgīsa.
an1.213:1.1: … who are impressive all around is Upasena son of Vaṅgantā.
an1.214:1.1: … who assign lodgings is Dabba Mallaputta.
an1.215:1.1: … who are beloved of the deities is Pilindavaccha.
an1.216:1.1: … with swift insight is Bāhiya of the Bark Cloth.
an1.217:1.1: … with brilliant speech is Kassapa the Prince.
an1.218:1.1: … who have attained the methods of textual analysis is Mahākoṭṭhita.”
